After the `amplify init` process, you can start adding backend services using the Amplify CLI. You can use the `amplify add <category>` command to add different categories of backend services such as authentication, API, storage, and more.

For example, to add authentication, you can use the following command:
```csharp
amplify add auth
```
This will open up a wizard where you can configure your authentication settings, such as the type of authentication, the authentication flow, and the social providers.

To add API, you can use the following command:
```csharp
amplify add api
```
This will also open up a wizard where you can configure your API settings, such as the API name, the REST or GraphQL API type, and the data source.

You can continue adding other backend services as per your app's requirements using the `amplify add <category>` command. Once you have added all the backend services, you can use the `amplify push` command to deploy your changes to the cloud.
can you walk me through the amplify add auth process and recommend me settings to use for this app?

Sure! Here are the steps to add authentication to your app using Amplify CLI:

1. Open your terminal and navigate to your app's root directory.
2. Run the command `amplify add auth`. This will launch the Amplify CLI wizard for adding authentication.
3. Choose the default authentication configuration: `Default configuration`.
4. Choose the authentication flow: `Username-Password (AWS Cognito User Pool)`.
5. Leave the advanced settings as default and press Enter.
6. Choose the sign in and sign up configuration: `Username`.
7. Leave the multi-factor authentication (MFA) configuration as default and press Enter.
8. Leave the email based user alias configuration as default and press Enter.
9. Leave the password policy configuration as default and press Enter.
10. Choose the default security configuration: `Allow access to unauthenticated users`.
11. Leave the OAuth configuration as default and press Enter.
12. Review the configuration and type `Y` to confirm the changes.

This will add authentication to your app using AWS Cognito User Pool with the default configuration. You can customize the configuration based on your app's requirements.
